name: Acquisition
description: A corporate action where one company takes over controlling interest in another company. The acquired company may continue to operate as an independent entity.

name: Divestiture
description: The process of selling off a portion of a company, such as a subsidiary, department, or property, often to streamline operations or raise capital.

name: Merger
description: A process where two or more companies combine to form a new entity, often to achieve synergies, expand market reach, or enhance capabilities.

name: Re-branding
description: The process of changing the corporate image of a company, including changes to logos, marketing materials, and overall brand strategy, to create a new identity.

name: Restructuring
description: A significant modification in the organization, strategy, or operations of a company, often in response to financial instability, market changes, or management decisions.

name: Spin-off
description: A type of corporate reorganization where a company creates a new independent company through the sale or distribution of new shares of an existing business/division.
